hotspots.label: Head and Eyes
hotspots.fact: Scorpions have simple eyes that help them sense light and movement in dark places where they live. Their eyes are part of their body structure that helps them survive as hunters. This is called **adaptation** — that's when an animal's body parts help it live in its environment.

vocabulary.definition: A special body part or behavior that helps an animal survive and live in its home.

hotspots.label: Segmented Abdomen
hotspots.fact: The scorpion's body is divided into many ring-like sections called segments that help it move and bend. These segments are connected together like a train made of connected cars, allowing the scorpion to curl its tail up for hunting. A scorpion's body is made up of these **segments** — that's why we call it **segmentation**, which helps the animal be flexible.

vocabulary.definition: When an animal's body is divided into many connected ring-like sections that help it move and bend.

hotspots.label: Tail with Stinger
hotspots.fact: The curved tail at the bottom is the scorpion's most important hunting tool—it has a venomous stinger to catch prey like insects and spiders. This tail helps the scorpion get food to eat, which is one of the basic **life functions** all animals need to survive. This is called a **behavioral adaptation** — that's when an animal uses a special body part to hunt or protect itself.

vocabulary.definition: The basic things all living things need to do to stay alive, like eating food, growing, and moving.

hotspots.label: Eight Legs
hotspots.fact: Scorpions have eight legs that help them walk quickly across the ground and climb over rocks and wood. These legs are part of their **body structure**, which means the way their body is built helps them move and hunt in their habitat. All arachnids, like spiders and scorpions, have exactly eight legs, which is how we can tell them apart from insects that have six legs.

vocabulary.definition: The way an animal's body is built with different parts that help it move, eat, and survive.
